alert.note: Alert for Chilton (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 6:09PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Chilton County through 645 PM CDT... At 609 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Maplesville, or 17 miles southwest of Jemison, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Maplesville, Parnell and Stanton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
